Единственный на моей памяти survival-horror, ориентированный на ТЕСНОЕ командное взаимодействие. Проще говоря, толковая система классов, разношерстные монстры и обилие оружие рождают поистине много командных тактик. Обязательна к покупке всем любителям загамать с посонами.
awesome game! everyone should own!

Certes ce jeu n'a pas des graphismes extraordinaires et le moteur du jeu comment à faire son âge. De plus on pourrait lui reprocher son ambiance (volontairement) crade avec ses décors souvents assez sombres, remplis de cadavres démembrés, ses murs tagués de sang, ses bruitages dérangeants, bref.
Pourtant, ça marche !
Le gameplay consiste à éliminier des vagues successives de zombies, ici pas de scénario. Pour vous aider sept classes sont à disposition allant du médecin au pyromane en passant par le berseker ou le demolition-man. Les zombies sont eux aussi répartis en plusieurs types allant de ceux qu'on peut tuer d'une balle dans la tête à de véritables tanks de L4D. Autres bons points en vrac, le feeling des armes qui est assez incroyable une fois bien pris en main, la coopération qui est omniprésente (et quasi-obligatoire si vous voulez survivre jusqu'au boss à la fin de chaque map), la difficulté qui est bien relevée et ajustable, les musiques qui font le job (ambiance métal) et, cerise sur le gâteau, le jeu est régulièrement mis à jour avec du contenu gratuit.

Looking for a challenging horror survival that requires teamwork? Look no further. Made by Tripwire Interactive; Killing Floor is an addicting horror title using Unreal Tournament 2004's engine. This game is a must-have if you like co-oping and/or fending off against waves and waves of enemies.

One of the best cooperative FPS games I've ever played.  You wander around various maps killing waves of zombies with up to 5 additional players.  TWI also features various seasonal events which keeps the game interesting.  It's simple and fun.
Gran juego cooperativo multijugador sin pretender ser un portento grafico.

Pretty much the only game I play.
In my opinion the best co-op fps. If you like exploding enemies that don't (all) shoot back.
It has a levelable class system (perks), so for the higher difficulties you'll have to use teamwork and/or level your perk to survive, (or just be very good). The game might be too easy at Beginner level, but from Normal level on it gets a lot more challenging.
Go as a Field medic and keep your party from becoming a human happy meal, set the world on fire as a Firebug, or lose the heavy weapons and go on a katana slaying spree as a Berserker!
Lots of goals, events, and achievements to keep the game interesting!

The only downside I could see about this game is that it doens't have  a storymode, if you're into that.

Update now that KF2 is out: The game is now many years older than when I wrote this review, but it has aged well. Even though the number of servers has fallen drastically, you're still able to find many different kinds of servers most of the time. Through the years, a ton of mods have been made as well, so even now the game is still interesting. And as far as I know there really isn't any other game like this (other than KF2, of course).

Многие считают Killing Floor клоном Left4Dead, поскольку у них общая тематика про зомби, да и кооперативное прохождение похожее у обеих игр. Но, разработчики прекрасно понимали, что просто клон не завоюет популярности и добавили в игру много новшеств, которые смогли заставить относится серьезно к их игре. На мой взгляд, хоть она и уступает популярному собрату, но играть в нее интересно, особенно когда надоест Left4Dead.

[h1]0/10[/h1]

With a well built community & excellently laid out gameplay, killing floor will satisfy the  even the most discerning pallet of the zombie enthusiast.

The weapons for maming zombies are plentifull; as are the species of hybrid zombies you will find yourselves combatting.
Weapons are class dependant with each class having it's own respective weapons such as the Berzerker which is a class that specialises in Melee weapons and thus has perks and discounts for that class to enable the average man to become a sword/chainsaw/other wielding maniac.
Whether a 9mm pistol is your thing or the 50. Handcannon, killing floor will surely have a weapon for you.

The gameplay is solid, to say the least...
The servers rarely crash (dependant on whether you're on the dedicated or not) and the weapons are pretty balanced when it comes to classes, no class is greatly overpowered but that being said, classes like the firebug and the demo are however easier to rack up large numbers of kills with in my experience.
The matches consist of 11 waves with each wave progessively getting harder due to the addition of zed species and quantity of zeds with the 11th wave being the climax where a character called 'The Patriarch' spawns and must be defeated in order to complete the wave and have victory declared.
The trader opens in between waves for a short predetermined amount of time and allows players to buy weapons, armour and ammunition.

Difficulties vary with difficulties being in their respective order: Beginner, Normal, Hard, Suicidal, Nightmare.
Beginner is the easiest gamemode with the trader being open the longest and zeds having the least amount of health, Nightmare on the otherhand has a shorter trading time and zeds are alot stronger.
To supplement this, Ammunition and weapons don't spawn on the map so players can't pick them up forcing players to either switch to Berzerker due to it's infinite amount of ammo or force them to coordinate their attacks in order to preserve ammunition.

Lastly, as a Veteran of this game, character dlc's aren't that usefull but the weapons expansion dlc's aren't neccessary to be bought because if one person has it, they can buy the weapons and drop them for all people to use therefore voiding the need to buy these packs.

Cheers
-Raptor

Well the amount of hours I logged in speak for themselves. This game is only fun if you you're playing multiplayer. Its boring and too hard on solo. You can join a server with up to 6 people for ordinary game mode, and the modded servers allow up to 30 people. It is hands down the best and most fun co-up survival game I ever plated. The metacritic score does this game no justice because it was the best €4 I ever spent. 
I could not recomment the game any more.

For the system requirements it asks, it looks really really good. I have nothing but fun playing it. The only drawback is sometimes it difficult to find a good server with a good set of 5 playing on the highest (Hell on Earth Difficulty). Can be fustrating at the highest difficulties and you need to reach lv6 (highest level) and the rest of your team also needs to be that high of a level to stand a chance surviving the 10 rounds (11th round is boss fight). The game basically consists of surviving wave after wave and you have a choce of 7 perks, all which have their positives and negatives and advantages in certain maps/situations/gameplay tactic. So picking a class later on to become very good at is important, but for the beginning is irrelevant. You become better with time, but I think you need 100hrs to achieve maximum efficiency with a couple of the 7 classes. So it is a big time investment if you want to master all the perks but the game is so much fun and the devs really update it often so the time flies by.
Tripwire made an amazing game here and although they did sell 1million + copies of this game, it deserves more and they deserve support since they are player friendly and are very active with the gaming community and constantly add new achievements, DLC and events even though the game has age. So I definitely recommend it without a doubt, especially if you like co-op games like Left4Dead. This game is everything left 4 dead should have been but wasn't! and in no way does Left4Dead deserve a higher score than this or higher popularity for that matter. Thats all I have to say about it.

Awsome game, a bit different than your run-of-the-mill zombie (I'm sorry [i]Specimen[/i]) game. It involves more team-play than others and teammates are happy to help.

Round-based zombie survival FPS with light RPG elements. You kill increasingly difficult zombie waves and purchase weapons & ammo between waves at a shop depending on the number and difficulty of your kills. There is a class system that you level up by performing certain tasks (headshots, healing team members, explosive damage, etc.) that give you better damage and eventually better starting weapons, allowing you to play harder difficulties. Overall this is a competent game but it can get tedious with every map having similar strategies.
